Strategic Applications in Digital Marketing

This module builds on Contemporary Issues module semester one where learners identified, analysed and considered some of the key challenges and issues facing their chosen specialist streams. In Strategic applications, learners will apply the business and management knowledge they have gained from previous learning and to integrate and to apply this knowledge to develop and offer strategic solutions to pressing issues in their specialist areas.

This module supplements ‘Strategy for Value Creation’ by providing applied and greater stream specific opportunities for learners to apply and learn how to use strategic management tools in relevant industries as well as a focus on the role that consulting plays in the strategic management process.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate understanding of the role of strategic management within organisations and the process issues associated with the strategic management of organisations (Knowledge & Understanding)

+  Identify and critically evaluate and select appropriate methodologies to address a range of complex international business problems. (Analysis, Enquiry)

+  Understanding and evaluating the role of international consulting in assisting with making strategic business and management decisions (Application, Enquiry)

+  Critically evaluate (both individually and as a team) complex issues systematically and employ appropriate and innovative solutions in complex and unpredictable international marketplace. (Problem Solving, Analysis, Application, Communication)
